abstract: Computes and returns the predicted timing information for the frame.
overview:
## Return Value

The predicted timing information for the specified frame, or `nil` if the layer is in the [doc://com.apple.compositorservices/documentation/CompositorServices/LayerRenderer/State-swift.enum/paused] or [doc://com.apple.compositorservices/documentation/CompositorServices/LayerRenderer/State-swift.enum/invalidated] state.

## Discussion

The returned type contains the timing information for the specified frame. Use related functions to retrieve specific values. For example, use the [doc://com.apple.compositorservices/documentation/CompositorServices/cp_frame_timing_get_optimal_input_time] function to determine when to start the submission phase of your frame update. This function updates the frame-specific timing information with the latest data from Compositor Services before it returns it.

Don’t call this function after you call [doc://com.apple.compositorservices/documentation/CompositorServices/cp_frame_query_drawable] for the specified frame. After you retrieve the frame’s [doc://com.apple.compositorservices/documentation/CompositorServices/cp_drawable_t] type, get the timing information from the drawable’s [doc://com.apple.compositorservices/documentation/CompositorServices/LayerRenderer/Drawable/frameTiming] function instead.

# cp_frame_predict_timing

**Function**

Computes and returns the predicted timing information for the frame.

## Declaration

```swift
cp_frame_timing_t cp_frame_predict_timing(cp_frame_t frame);
```

## Parameters

- **frame**: The frame you’re preparing to draw.

## Return Value

The predicted timing information for the specified frame, or `nil` if the layer is in the [doc://com.apple.compositorservices/documentation/CompositorServices/LayerRenderer/State-swift.enum/paused] or [doc://com.apple.compositorservices/documentation/CompositorServices/LayerRenderer/State-swift.enum/invalidated] state.

## Discussion

The returned type contains the timing information for the specified frame. Use related functions to retrieve specific values. For example, use the [doc://com.apple.compositorservices/documentation/CompositorServices/cp_frame_timing_get_optimal_input_time] function to determine when to start the submission phase of your frame update. This function updates the frame-specific timing information with the latest data from Compositor Services before it returns it.

Don’t call this function after you call [doc://com.apple.compositorservices/documentation/CompositorServices/cp_frame_query_drawable] for the specified frame. After you retrieve the frame’s [doc://com.apple.compositorservices/documentation/CompositorServices/cp_drawable_t] type, get the timing information from the drawable’s [doc://com.apple.compositorservices/documentation/CompositorServices/LayerRenderer/Drawable/frameTiming] function instead.

## Getting timing information

- **cp_frame_timing_get_optimal_input_time**: Returns the optimal time to start the frame submission process.
- **cp_frame_timing_get_rendering_deadline**: Returns the time at which you must finish all work for the specified frame.
- **cp_frame_timing_get_presentation_time**: Returns the time at which the system displays the frame.
- **cp_frame_timing_t**: A type that stores information about a frame’s encoding, rendering, and presentation deadlines.
